page.title: 18SCHOOLS
page.content: Maendy Junior School is 109 years old. It has 48 pupils who are split up into 3 classes and 3 teachers, including the headmaster.The catchment area for the school covers several small villages as it is a country school. The school has 2 playgrounds and has 1 computer. They also have a dining room, but school dinners are brought in. Cowbridge Comprehensive School was formed in 1974, from the boys grammar school (17th century) The girls grammar (late 19th century) and the Llanharry Secondary Modern. Today the school is situated on three sites, the lower school in town,the middle school and sixth form on Aberthin road. There are approximately 1,100 pupils with 64 staff the catchment area for the school covers all the Vale.
